ygData.subject: Re: Supplies in Freeport
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the info, but I still couldn t find the firing sheets. I went to East Commonlands and followed the path.  He is not in the first 3 single buildings
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks for the info, but I still couldn't find the firing sheets.

I went to East Commonlands and followed the path. He is not in
the first 3 single buildings (no Inn, just buildings) so I continued
on. There is then an Inn on the left side of path where there is
usually a single guard. He was not in the two single buildings
next to the inn, so I tried the Inn itself. Two merchants were there,
not with that name or firing sheets, and one was on top of the
building. The one on top of the building did not have that name
though (some generic name like Innkeep Frank).

Am I missing something or is this not the right Inn? ALL I WANT
ARE SOME FIRING SHEETS...seems like it should be simple.
Why would Verant make it so hard to do trade skills? It's not like
you can make much money from them.

Thanks again for the help.

A frustrated wanna-be
potter,

Soren

BobbiS7@... wrote:

> From: BobbiS7@...
>
> In a message dated 5/25/1999 5:43:23 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
> EQ_Potters@onelist.com writes:
>
> > From: Donald Taber <dtaber@...>
>
> Well Met Soren
>
> > Where can I get firing sheets around Freeport?
>
> East Commonlands at the first INN. Look for Martin Clayfinger.
> At night, he seems like to fix his roof - alot.
>
> I also managed to find a new supply of clay at the Dwarven
> Armory in North Freeport, but they don't have firing sheets.
>
> > I have been doing baking and wanted to
> > start pottery to help out the baking.
>
> I find they kinda go hand & hand... there is an EQ_Bakers list too.
>
> I finally after many trys (low skill), got a set of skewers made.
>
> Cleric Taven (Veeshan)
> Brotherhood of Balance
>
